page.title: 17SKERRIES WILDLIFE
page.content: There is a very limited variety of animals on Skerries:{rats, rabbits, seals and very rarely{otters.}The seals are mostly{common seals}but there are some{grey seals}which are slightly larger and have more pointed noses. There is however a good selection of birds and most of them have Shetland names. The most common birds during the summer are{tirricks (Arctic Terns),{maalies}(Fulmars), {shalders}(Oystercachers),{tammie {nories}(Puffins) and{scories}(Common gulls). The most vicious birds are {bonxies}(Great Skuas) and{black backed {gulls.}In the summer,birdwatchers come to Skerries to see the many small migrants. There is an ornithologist on the island. The birds which he rings have been found in as diverse places as North Africa and Sweden. {
